intro: Boerhavia anisophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf bluestem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, adding visual interest to its appearance. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Boerhavia anisophylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
